lead_paragraph: There have been no direct talks between the sides, but the United Nations mediator said he considered the negotiations officially started because he had conferred with each delegation.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Geneva, and Julie Hirschfeld Davis from Rome.
byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and ANNE BARNARD

headline.print_headline: Syria Talks Are Declared Open as Mediator Begins Shuttle Diplomacy
headline.main: Syria Talks Are Declared Open as Mediator Begins Shuttle Diplomacy

snippet: There have been no direct talks between the sides, but the United Nations mediator said he considered the negotiations officially started because he had conferred with each delegation.
abstract: United Nations mediator Staffan de Mistura opens Syria peace talks with plea to world powers implicated in conflict to make effort to decrease tensions; diplomat is encouraged by results of separate meetings with opposition delegation and Syrian government officials; progress hinges on Syrian government lifting its sieges and American-led coalition's success in fighting Islamic State.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
